definition: To temporarily acquire possession of an item or resource from someone else, with the understanding that it will be returned at a later time. This term is commonly used when referring to borrowing something, such as books, money, or other objects, from another person.

examples.german: Kannst du mir bitte Geld borgen?
examples.english: Can you please lend me some money?

examples.german: Ich habe ihm mein Auto geborgt.
Kann ich mir deinen Stift borgen?
Er hat mir sein Buch geborgt.
Kannst du mir deinen Regenschirm borgen?
examples.english: Can you lend me your umbrella?
